titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Middle East and Africa Program, Correspondence
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, International Division, Middle East and Africa Program, Correspondence FA1425
titlestmt.author: Katie Martin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-06-12 00:02:38 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Middle East and Africa Program, Correspondence

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Ford Foundation's Middle East and Africa (MEA) Program originated in 1958 as the Near East and Africa Program, a regional program area within Overseas Development. The Ford Foundation became more involved in the region with the opening of field offices in Beirut in 1953 and Cairo in 1959. MEA became part of the International Division in 1966 when the Overseas Development Program, along with other international Foundation programs, became part of one International Division. The collection spans from 1960-1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence and memoranda from the Middle East and Africa (MEA) Program, including general chronological correspondence files and correspondence from the field offices of Cairo, Lagos, Beirut, Ankara, Nairobi, and Tunis.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into two series:

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to RAC in 2017 by the Ford Foundation and ingested by RAC as Accession 2017:087.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains general circulating correspondence and memoranda files from the Middle East and Africa Program. The correspondence relates to potential grant projects, field office finances, personnel, and general office issues. Individuals who received and responded to the correspondence and memoranda include: J. Wayne Fredericks, Wilbert LeMelle, Thomas Scott, Willard Hertz, Ben Lewis, William T. Irelan, William A. Herman, Haskell G. Ward, Ann W. Noyes, Betty White, David Bell, Francis Sutton, Howard Swearer, William P. Gormbley, Mr. Horah, Courtney Nelson, Elisa Scatena, John A. Quinn, David Pfanner, Elsie Capozzi, Oscar Harkavy, James Himes, George Zeidenstein, Mr. Bunnell, Mr. Miller, and Miss Klimbach.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Individual folders are arranged reverse chronologically

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence files from the field offices within the Middle East and Africa (MEA) Program, including Cairo, Lagos, Beirut, Ankara, Nairobi, Tunis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 15: 1967 January-1967 May
Folder 16: 1966 June-December
Folder 17: 1960 May-1966 May

Contains memoranda, telegrams, and correspondence regarding finances, personnel, US Embassy demands, and everyday office life of the Ford Foundation's Cairo Office from 1962-1967. Most memoranda are from (or involve) J. Donald Kingsley, Donald M. Stewart, James S. Lipscomb, Nabil Haddad, and Harvey Hall

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 18: 1967 September-1968 April
Folder 19: 1967 June-August

Contains memoranda, telegrams, and correspondence regarding finances, personnel, US Embassy demands, and everyday office life of the Ford Foundation's Cairo Office from 1962-1967. Most memoranda are from (or involve) J. Donald Kingsley, Donald M. Stewart, James S. Lipscomb, Nabil Haddad, and Harvey Hall. Folder 19 contains telegrams and memoranda regarding Ford Foundation staff and families leaving Cairo due to increasing unrest in the Middle East in May 1967.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 20: 1966 August-November
Folder 21: 1966 January-July
Folder 22: 1964 August-1965 December

Contains memoranda, telegrams, and correspondence regarding finances, personnel, and everyday office life of the Ford Foundation's Lagos Office from 1964-1966. Most memoranda are from (or involve) J. Donald Kingsley, David Heaps, Frank J. Moore, and James T. Ivy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 23: 1967 July-December
Folder 24: 1967 April-June
Folder 25: 1967 January-March

Contains memoranda, telegrams, and correspondence regarding finances, personnel, and everyday office life of the Ford Foundation's Lagos Office from 1967. Most memoranda are from (or involve) J. Donald Kingsley, David Heaps, Frank J. Moore, and James T. Ivy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains memoranda, telegrams, and correspondence regarding finances, personnel, and everyday office life of the Ford Foundation's Lagos Office from 1968. Most memoranda are from (or involve) J. Donald Kingsley, David Heaps, Frank J. Moore, and James T. Ivy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 27: 1967 April-July
Folder 28: 1966 August-1967 June
Folder 29: 1964 April-1966 August

Contains memoranda, telegrams, and correspondence regarding finances, personnel, and everyday office life of the Ford Foundation's Beirut Office from 1964-1967. Most memoranda are from (or involve) W. Hugh Walker, J. Donald Kingsley, Harvey P. Hall, James T. Ivy, Clark Bloom, and David Heaps

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 30: 1966 December-1967 November
Folder 31: 1965 October-1966 November
Folder 32: 1963 December-1965 September

Contains memoranda, telegrams, and correspondence regarding finances, personnel, and everyday office life of the Ford Foundation's Ankara Office from 1964-1967. Most memoranda are from (or involve) J. Donald Kingsley, James T. Ivy, Robert Kerwin, and Eugene Northrop

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains memoranda, telegrams, and correspondence regarding finances, personnel, and everyday office life of the Ford Foundation's Ankara Office from 1968. Most memoranda are from (or involve) J. Donald Kingsley and Eugene Northrop.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 34: 1967 August-1968 March
Folder 35: 1967 February-July
Folder 36: 1963 September-1967 January

Contains memoranda, telegrams, and correspondence regarding finances, personnel, and everyday office life of the Ford Foundation's Nairobi Office from 1963-1967. Most memoranda are from (or involve) J. Donald Kingsley, John Robin, James T. Ivy, and David R. Smock

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 37: 1967 June-December
Folder 38: 1966 September-1967 December
Folder 39: 1964 September-1966 August

Contains memoranda, telegrams, and correspondence regarding finances, personnel, and everyday office life of the Ford Foundation's Tunis Office from 1964-1967. Most memoranda are from (or involve) J. Donald Kingsley, David Heaps, Donald Stewart, and James Hardy.
